website_summaries.verdict: An all-around great filler-free dog food that utilizes natural and nourishing ingredients alongside its main protein, such as carrots, chia seeds, and oatmeal.
pros: Contains high-fiber ancient grains like brown rice, barley, and quinoa
Deboned beef is the first ingredient
No preservatives, fillers, corn, wheat, soy, or gluten
cons: Not for dogs with grain allergies

customer_reviews.title: Good recipe, but the kibbles are very small
customer_reviews.text: Merrick food is great and my doxie mix likes this recipe, but the nuggets are so small that she ends up swallowing most of them whole and only chews some of them. Actual size of the kibble really should be shown on the outside of the bag. I had to go to another Merrick owned brand to find little bit larger pieces. This recipe would be perfect for mini dachshunds or any of the similar small dogs. The coin in my pic is for size reference - 3 pieces from this recipe, 1 from another product.
customer_reviews.author: Connie C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect food for the smallest puppy.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product for my wee little Pom - Chi. He was only 1.4 pounds when we brought him home. this food was easily disgested by the little guy. He loves the food. UPDATED REVIEW: We are getting bigger- 4.5 pounds and 8 months old now. House trained to 98%....Peanuts is showing off his new wintertime coat.(Also bought on Amazon - and about 6 other sweaters and pj's on Amazon). He Still loves his kibbles so much. He has been neutered and was so happy when he was allowed to eat his kibbles again. We have added a few carrots and a tiny bit of wet food.
customer_reviews.author: DazzleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Made my senior yorkie violently ill! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: This is a brand with reputation for its quality and this small breed recipe really made my 10 year old senior yorkie suffer. At first she was throwing up and then diarrhea followed- it lasted a week. We had no idea it was the food that was making her sick until the second time she got violently ill again. She had fully recovered from the first time by taking antibiotics and prescription food. When she returned to eating this food again, the diarrhea and vomitting immediately returned. I’m really surprised there isnt a recall on this food. There is something seriously wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: I have had my dog since he was 3 months ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had my dog since he was 3 months old. He is now 3 years old. He has NEVER has loose stool. Somehow, this food managed to accomplish that. I stopped this food, went to another and the loose stool stopped. I then went back to this one to make sure because I had another bag of it and yep, loose stool again. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Whit

customer_reviews.title: Awesome results!
customer_reviews.text: I had switched the pups to this food several months ago because my Yorkie has a bad knee and I was hoping the glucosamine and chondroitin levels in the food would help. Yesterday was his yearly with the Vet for check up and shots. She was not aware of the change in food and was surprised when she found a significant improvement in his knee when she examined it. She added a note to his chart about the change and said she isn't sure it is the food but don't stop. I am a very happy fur Momma.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: High quality dog food - great size bites for small chihuahua dogs
customer_reviews.text: The ingredients list says it all. The size of the bites is easier for my small chihuahua dogs to chew, I still put a spoonful chicken broth on my tiny teacup dog's food to soften the bites just a bit for his itty bitty mouth. But my regular sized chihuahua doesn't need anything done for his bites. I dice up a tablespoon of chicken and sprinkle on top. I am happy with Merrick small bites classic dog food, they give all the nutrients the dogs need and I have been feeding it to my dogs for a year, and I have beautiful, healthy, happy chihuahuas. Highly recommend Merrick Classic small bites dry dog food.
customer_reviews.author: TDK (NYC)

customer_reviews.title: Merrick  Classic small breed
customer_reviews.text: My finicky eater little buddy loves this food ! It's the perfect size kibble for a small breed and he thinks it taste good . This is actually the first dry food I've ever found that he will eat... and he's 6 years old !! I'm so glad I found this food. It has made my life so much easier. No more tummy squirting noises, the dreaded diarrhea.. I was in a what to find him to eat nightmare. No more worries of I made my buddy sick guilty feeling. We're both happy now ! 5 little paws I rate this food ! Reasonably priced is an additional benefit and I love that too !
customer_reviews.author: Betsy H.

customer_reviews.title: Cost cutting by Nestle Purina ruins product
customer_reviews.text: The bag no longer is reinforced with velcro to shut it to keep the food "fresh." If Nestle Purina is so desperate to remove this feature from the bag to save a dime, imagine what they are doing to the actual ingredients. A crying shame a good company Merrick with a great product is ruined by low rent low quality big profit Purina. Horrible. Have boycotted companies like Purina my entire life for good reason.
customer_reviews.author: taylor

customer_reviews.title: He seems to like it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only food my dog seems to eat. He has a sensitive tummy and can’t eat chicken anymore. Otherwise he gets a terrible itching problem. He HATES fish, so beef it is!! The bag lasts him a little over a month (he’s 7lbs) so it’s a good value for the money. I can’t comment on the taste, let me ask him. He said “woof” with a tail wag, so I’ll say the flavor is great!! This food really helped my baby stop itching. Ever since the switch he’s had no allergic reaction! So if your pup has food allergies, give this one a try! It’s also NOT grain free which is better for your dogs heart.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Barton

customer_reviews.title: SkincareK gives two thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: This food is american sourced except for the lamb from New Zealand, american made in their own facilities and all natural. I have 3 dogs- a 120 lb malamute, 80 lb weimeriner and 15 lb Lhasa apso and they eat less, poop less and shed less. Do the math people use natural food!!
customer_reviews.author: SkincareK

customer_reviews.title: Making my dogs sick! May be a bad batch
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have been eating this product for years! I stocked up on the 3 bags because of everything going on and I mixed them all into one canister. Something is off and it keeps making not one but both of my dogs sick! Now I need to throw the three bags of food away because I don’t know what’s wrong with which one. Really disappointed and concerned it’s making my dogs so sick. My dogs are on a really strict diet so I know it’s this food because it’s within an hour after they eat it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highest levels of glucosamine and chondroitin
customer_reviews.text: Dogs have been on varying merrick foods for years. If you have one with mobility issues not all merrick foods have the same levels of glucosamine and chondroitin. Read the levels, highest I have seen is 1200 but varies greatly by flavor, life stage etc. **UPDATE** 05/2020 Due to my vets recommendation we only buy the classic with grains as new info suggests grain free is linked to heart issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware: False advertising, this is not what you will receive
customer_reviews.text: I am NOT happy right now, I just received my order for the small breed healthy grains and the food that I received was not what I ordered, it has PEAS as the 3rd ingredient and the specific one I ordered has a description of pea free, lentil free, potato free. Im angry and very disappointed you would sell this as the Healthy Grain Version and send an entirely different recipe version.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Winfield

customer_reviews.title: Good for 15lb cockapoo pup
customer_reviews.text: Kibble size is smaller than the regular classic version, which seems more appealing to my 15lb cockapoo. Ingredients seem average, but we keep this in stock in case our dog gets picky and doesn't eat her usual kibble. Doesn't give her the runs either, which is always a plush. We're a big fan of Merrick in general, and will most likely continue to buy this when we run low. I don't like how the 4lb size doesn't have the same closure as the bigger bags. I can only clip it with a bag clip so kibble tends to go stale quicker. Merrick - you should update the packaging!!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Even my picky 2 lb maltese loves this
customer_reviews.text: My 12 lb Mal-chi and 2 lb purebred maltese both love this food, and it was approved by their veterinary dietician at U Penn Vet School as their main diet, so I have it on Subscribe and Save and get it for much less than Chewy or even my local pet stores, and I don't have to leave my house. What's not to love?
customer_reviews.author: Kayleigh

customer_reviews.title: This made my dog sick!
customer_reviews.text: Should have read the reviews! But my dog has eaten Merrick food for years so I didn’t hesitate to buy. Read the reviews after and found like many others that there is something not right about this food. He was only fed it for 2 days and had diarrhea during that time. Never happened with any other Merrick food before. Do not buy this food! Amazon was great though and refunded my money.
customer_reviews.author: D Lee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my pooch
customer_reviews.text: Switched to Merrick after it was found out that blue buffalo was putting "bad" ingredients in their food. I honestly have never looked back. This food makes my dogs coat so soft and shiny. She has plenty of energy. Added bonus is that all the dog kibbles are the same shape and size, so my dog doesn't pick out some of the pieces while leaving the rest like she did with Blue Buffalo. Though we use an airtight container for her food, since we live in humid south Florida, it is a nice touch that the bag is resealable, unlike so many others.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Little

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, not for my picky dog
customer_reviews.text: My Amstaff is indifferent to this food. Firstly, I received the previous version of this food. I understand they are transitioning to the new version, which is what I ordered, but don’t arbitrarily decide for me and send me the old ver. Secondly, I need to add an egg or chicken before he will begin to eat it or else it just sits in his bowl all day. I’ve switched to Purina One (after many dog food purchases/returns) and will sneak in the Merrick until it is gone.
customer_reviews.author: JPM

customer_reviews.title: Bad bag? Dog got SICK
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if its a bad bag but my dog got SICK when he started on this. I had a small bag from my local Petco to make sure he can stomach it. I got this bag and he started puking and #2-ing loosely. Stopped and threw this out immediately!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: I know my puppies like it right away
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding my 2 yorkies this product more than 2 months and I know they like it right away. It might be the flavor, it might be not too hard to chew or ... they just like it. I am royal to other brand for 6 years because of recommendation from vet. Never plan to change to other brand till I decided to try something different to them. After read the review, I chose this product ,honestly I was worried very. But I was wrong totally. Now I am going to subscribe & save $$$
customer_reviews.author: peggy tsai

customer_reviews.title: We've since switched over to Merrick Grain Free and she seems to really enjoy that variety - I've also noticed her bowel movemen
customer_reviews.text: My dog use to be a huge fan of this variety of Merrick until recently. I don't know if it was the company being bought out or alleged formula change - all I know is that she refused to eat it. First, we thought she wasn't feeling well - but she gladly ate any other food we presented to her. We've since switched over to Merrick Grain Free and she seems to really enjoy that variety - I've also noticed her bowel movements has improved significantly since switching.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: My dog got sick from this food!!
customer_reviews.text: This dog food was recommended to me from a friend who also buys this food from Amazon. After about 5 days of eating this food, my dog started becoming very lethargic and stopped eating. He had no energy and was sleeping all the time. I immediately stopped feeding him this food. I gave the rest to my friend who recommended this food and she just texted me saying her dog started throwing up. Just be careful when buy8ng dog food online.
customer_reviews.author: eabates

customer_reviews.title: I went searching for the best and closest kibble for you and Merrick Dry Dog ...
customer_reviews.text: My Dog is a hybrid Morky and has been fed a raw diet for his first two years of his life. He started not eating most of his food every feeding. I tried everything by switching is raw protein but nothing worked. I went searching for the best and closest kibble for you and Merrick Dry Dog Food and its ingredients have so far been the best. So I had the kibble to his raw food and he seems to like his food better. Sometimes at night I will just feed him Merrick food. So far it has been a win, win. Thanks so much. Debra and Buddy
customer_reviews.author: Debra Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Made dog VERY SICK!
customer_reviews.text: Most recent bag sent by Amazon has made my dog very SICK. Throwing up, diarrhea, a trip to the vet, lethargic, no appetite. I’m not sure what happened because we’ve ordered this food for 6+ months with no issue. But the rest of this bag is going in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Made my dogs sick
customer_reviews.text: I have always gotten this dog food in this exact flavor for my dogs but this most recent purchase must’ve been a bad batch one of my dogs had diarrhea thought it was isolated and then today my other dog vomited the food shortly after eating it.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha A

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food
customer_reviews.text: We have a 7 pound chihuahua mix and a 45 pound American Staffordshire mix. The size of this food is perfect for both and they love it. Their digestive systems have cleaned up as we had problems with other "premium" dog foods. Now our cats are also eating the food. Haha Finally found the perfect dog(/cat) food!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Lynn Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: This product gave my pug diarrhea. They changed the formula. Have been using this for a year and all of a sudden they changed the formula. I tried using rice and chicken and then switching back slowly to this food. Diarrhea came back. Don’t know what the problem is but never buying Merrick again
customer_reviews.author: sunny

customer_reviews.title: Recent bag made dog ill
customer_reviews.text: We have been feeding our 5 year old shepherd/lab mix this food since we got him. Suddenly with our most recent bag of food he had had a terrible case of diarrhea. We will be switching him to something else and ordering from a different site from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S.

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Be advised, you do not get what you buy. While the image and description is advertising this dog food as lentil, pea, and potatoe free, the bag I received does include peas. In fact, peas are the third ingredient on the list. Furthermore, while it says the protein content should be 26%, the bag I received has 30%. I specifically bought this food, because it was supposed to be pea free and have a lower protein count. Two things to look out for when choosing dog food. Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Christine A. Oftring-rider

customer_reviews.title: Quality Food
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing this monthly for about a year now. My dog loves it (12 pound Shihpoo) and she has been finicky about many other brands. The ingredients are quality as far as dry dog food goes. This has a 4.5/5 from Dog Food Adviser.
customer_reviews.author: Azar

customer_reviews.title: Still old recipe.......Updated
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping for the new recipe when ordered on 2/19. Hopefully puppy has no issues with this. Switched from Pro Plan. ***edit*** Tried mixing blended it into the puppies current food. Was going pretty well until we got to the 75/25 ration. Puppy started to have soft stool, which transitioned to full on diarrhea the past 2 days. Had to change to a bland diet of boiled chicken and rice yesterday. Hopefully this will fix the diarrhea and switch back to her old food. Bummer bc the ingredients looks really good.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonGreddy

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food
customer_reviews.text: Good natural dog food - my dog is fussy but she has been eating this for 1 1/2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Moynihan

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size bits for my little guy!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size bits for my Yorkie. My dog really loves this brand of dog food. He is not a picky dog by any means, but he seems to really like the flavor. I like to alternate the flavors so as to give him a sense of not having the same food all the time. I have been using Merrick brand for about 8-9 months and have not used any other brand. I figure why should I if my dog loves it and there are many varieties to choose from. Would highly recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small dog size & great flavor
customer_reviews.text: This is a very small, plain looking kibble for small breads. My little dogs all like it and they can be very picky at times. They have a bowl to share daily and it is usually gone unless it's been out too long. They won't eat it if it's stale.bso we usually throw out the old and provide fresh daily. The bag comes with a resealable top opening which one of the best I've seen. Stays shut vwery well so we left the food in the bag and then put it in our plast storage bin for added freshness. Easy to pour from bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jewels

customer_reviews.title: Sully likes it!
customer_reviews.text: Tiny little balls of goodness, Sully won’t eat anything else. My spoiled 7 pound ball of energy says it all. He never tires of this wonder food. Sully says keep making it for another ten years - he just turned eight.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly A Evert

customer_reviews.title: Diarrhea palooza
customer_reviews.text: After feeding my dogs this product for a while with no issues the last bag of dog food caused loose stool for a week. What a mess!
customer_reviews.author: gee

customer_reviews.title: Good healthy grains and made in USA
customer_reviews.text: We got a new West Highland Terrier puppy, and they can be prone to skin issues. Due to the current controversy, the vet did not want her on a grain free diet. This is one of the few well-known brands, that you can find with healthy grains and it’s made in the USA. She loves it and no problems so far
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you want a high quality dry puppy food, choose this one.
customer_reviews.text: If I had done more homework before our puppy got here a full week sooner than expected, I'd have gone to Merrick's Puppy Plate canned food. I have too many tasks to add more to cook from scratch, but Merrick's is a highly rated dog food that our golden has thrived on for years. I've just ordered the Puppy Plate cans, and I'll blend the kibble into it to transition the pup gradually. I respect others who see no problem using the kibble by itself. In a perfect world, I'd prepare both dogs' meals at home.
customer_reviews.author: Pomaikai

customer_reviews.title: Dog likes it
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, my dog does well on this. I do have about 3 different brands I use for my dog and I mix them up in a big container. I like to give her a good high quality variety to ensure she gets the right nutrients
customer_reviews.author: BobbiVi

customer_reviews.title: My little doxies love this...BUT...
customer_reviews.text: My little dogs love this food - wish this particular flavor came in one size larger. It is expensive to get this size bag, but it is the only size I can get. Also, two of the last three bags I received from Amazon have been cut (not by Merrick, but looked like they were cut when stocked), and I didn’t notice it until I had opened the bag, so I couldn’t return - I should have paid more attention.
customer_reviews.author: B H

customer_reviews.title: Doggo seems to love it.
customer_reviews.text: We got an old, old rescue dog, and I honestly didn’t expect her to live too long. That said, she did great on this food - she perked right up and she doesn’t act like an old dog anymore. She’s a happy dog, and I’m happy to have her around.
customer_reviews.author: The Rodent

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog sick
customer_reviews.text: This food made my mini Goldendoodle sick. Just as other reviews have said, my dog vomited a few times and had diarrhea the entire month she was eating this food. I gradually introduced this new food and I even took her to the vet and got two different medications. I have as a last resort stopped the food and her diarrhea has finally stopped. I gave this product two stars because she did seem to like the flavor. I do not recommend this food for any dog after what we have been through this month.
customer_reviews.author: klnash

customer_reviews.title: ... my pets for the last four years and they love it. It really seemed to make a difference ...
customer_reviews.text: I've bought Merrick dog food for my pets for the last four years and they love it. It really seemed to make a difference in how they felt and looked after a few months of being on it. We could definitely see a change in our dogs. I have highly recommended this dog food to all of my friends! You can definitely say I like it for my pets.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah J Alexander

customer_reviews.title: My Pups love this food
customer_reviews.text: My pups love the Merrick brand dry food. The crunchies are a perfect size. I have small dogs and tried their little bites, as well as their regular and my babies, can easily manage both. I have now ordered 2 different flavors in the 4 pound bags each month for 3 months so my babies don't get bored. They love the food and I love that it is a great healthy option they love. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Nature's Minion

customer_reviews.title: Can't Get Enough
customer_reviews.text: A great alternative of kibble for my pup--between this and Rachel Ray Nutrish, she's good! She cannot get enough of these, especially with different toppers. Quality ingredients, no fillers, no grain, corn, chemicals, and minimal processing, it's just great stuff. THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.author: PurpleKMoore85

customer_reviews.title: Great quality & pups love it
customer_reviews.text: My two 13 week old standard poodle puppies LOVE their food. Vet recommended that their food include grains (returned grained free) because studies have shown that it builds stronger resistance to cancers. Nonetheless Boaz & Nala absolutely go nutso for breakfast, lunch & dinner. Nice quality and our bag was fresh/no bugs, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Hoyang

customer_reviews.title: The dogs say "Nom nom nom"!
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old Chihuahua and 9 month old Pomeranian absolutely love this dry food! They also get Merrick wet food and cottage cheese for their meals, which they also love, and they can be picky little buggers! I'll continue ordering this until they tell me they're over it!
customer_reviews.author: asader83

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: The product I ordered was supposed to be without peas, potatoes or lentils. However, what I received was without potatoes only. It caused my toy poodles to have loose stools.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda G.

customer_reviews.title: Bad bag, gave my dog diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: My dog has had bad diarrhea since I received this. Have bought before with no issues. No more Merrick.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne McInerney

customer_reviews.title: Too bad. Bring back the old recipe Merrick
customer_reviews.text: This recipe was changed over the last year. Too bad. Bring back the old recipe Merrick. Sensitive stomach dog has had no problems on the old recipe until the change. Smaller bag also was not a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Package Expiration Date Approaching
customer_reviews.text: The product is great and I have used it for a year. My problem is the fact that a 25lb bag was delivered with an expiration date of August 2017. Its April now and while technically it is not expired, this bag was clearly from an "excess supply" and that's why the price was so good. I can obtain the same product elsewhere for the same price without a near term "freshness date" concern.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I chose for the quality & ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I looked at many brands & ingredients. I chose this Merrick because I thought the skin & joint potential would help My Boston Terrier the most. So far, She’s not crazy about it, & I haven’t noticed any improvement as I hoped. I’ll try another Merrick, or Brand next.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good but pricey.
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes this dry food but it is very pricey. I like everything about the ingredients but feeding a large dog gets expensive when you are on a budget. I buy this every other time and buy Nutrish the rest. As I understand it, the Nutrish has the same healthy ingredients but at a much cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: Pet Lover

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this! ❤️😊🐶
customer_reviews.text: I love this food! 2 of my dogs have allergies and are very picky eaters. It also costs a lot to buy separate foods. I feed this to all my dogs and they love it and are healthier also. Note - if you are planning on switching foods mix old food and new food to keep from upsetting tummies. Some people say the food gave their dog diarrhea but it was probably because they didnt transition from old food to new food. The instructions for transitioning are on the side of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine2871

customer_reviews.title: Great food.
customer_reviews.text: Love this food for our 7.5lb mini schnauzer puppy :) Good quality ingredients... made in the US... will not break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: RPH

customer_reviews.title: Lab Tested... English Lab Tested
customer_reviews.text: My English Lab is a picky eater but she wakes me up early because she is so excited to have her breakfast time song and first scoop of her favorite food. In the past she has had food sensitivity and this food she really enjoys without any upset tummy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Aprapas

customer_reviews.title: Kibble size way too small
customer_reviews.text: I usually feed our Shepsky large breed dog food because she tends to eat a little too fast but she would at least chew large kibbles. I decided to give this a try because ingredients look good with a good load of protein with grains included. She seems to like the flavor (not a picky eater). The problem is that the kibbles are way too small. So small that it’s almost same size as the puppy food I feed to our labradoodle puppy, and about half the size of other adult kibbles. So I will not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: eunbook

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: I deduct 1 star out because (i am on a subscription) twice the bag came without the sealing mechanism. (missing belcro looking sealing parts inside the bag) I deduct 1 more star. it has been continuously shipping with defect packaging (no re-sealing belcro)
customer_reviews.author: Dongwoo Lim

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 dogs on this and also the puppy. As soon as I opened the bag it was a good non fragrant smell, not like barn hay. I just switched from another well known Holistic food that was causing burps and pancreatitis after 10 years, weird.
customer_reviews.author: AussiegirlIngridTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Love this brand!
customer_reviews.text: Merrick is a terrific brand. I buy the dry and canned food for my puppy and mix it together. I was introduced to this brand when I rescued my dog and the sponsor family was using Merrick to feed their dogs. I was given a small bag to take home and have been sold ever since. Now, my son and daughter both use Merrick for their dogs. Some of the reviews have stated that their cans arrived damaged. I have never had this problem. Merrick also donates to worthy causes, like K9 Warriors. I have purchased the canned Hero's Banquet and like that I am getting excellent quality, too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grains are not the answer
customer_reviews.text: Switched my 8 year old pit from the grain free version to this ancient grains version, she's been on it 3 weeks. Now her farts are rancid and non stop, poo is super soft and she can't quit itching. On the old food, none of these things were issues. I jumped the gun because of the so called grain free link to canine heart disease. Don't fall for it, this food sucks.
customer_reviews.author: uncle tomahawk

customer_reviews.title: Pup loves it
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Pup loves the flavor and hasn't had any negative response. As long as you get the Merrick with grains! Be aware of Merrick without grains. It is on the list to stay away from.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin V Voras

customer_reviews.title: Great for tiny dogs especially!
customer_reviews.text: My little, older chihuahuas love the taste, and the size of the kibble is perfect! It’s small enough for even my toothless dog, as long as I let it soak in a bit of hot water and coat it with some warmed canned food! :)
customer_reviews.author: Julia Amundsen

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase. This is not real Merrick dog food. My dogs noticed the difference right away and did not want to eat it. If you go to Merrick website they have a $3 off manufacturer coupon that is always active and buy from authorized store- Petco or your local pet supplies store.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Great product-packaging issues
customer_reviews.text: Great overall product that is not unnecessarily “grain free”. However, my problem is with the packaging. Every other time I receive the item, the bag does not have a seal on it as it should. Makes keeping it fresh difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly K.

customer_reviews.title: Not great if dog has sensitive tummy
customer_reviews.text: Made my Shih Tzu sick although he loves the flavor:). Wish I had purchased on Chewey because they have completely refunded the purchase. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: SuzanneB

customer_reviews.title: vomiting) and this one has been the best for him
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this. He has had a lot of issues with other foods from more commercial brands (allergic reactions, diarrhea, vomiting) and this one has been the best for him. No issues since we switched. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Justin M

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: Never again! While my shichon puppy loves all of Merrick's food, this one is a no go. He didn't like it at all. After only eating a little, he had loose bowels and threw up. I'll stick with his usual Merrick Grain Free Puppy Real Chicken & Sweet Potato Dry Dog Food.
customer_reviews.author: C MTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Was this really Merrick
customer_reviews.text: My dog got really sick after eating this. I wasn’t sure it was the food and so I gave it to her again after I stopped her from eating it for a few days and then she started getting sick again.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting and healthy food for our dogs!!
customer_reviews.text: Love that this wonderful product delivers every month at the exact time my dogs happen to be running low on their food!!! The quality is always fabulous and the dogs love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: My dog is doing better!
customer_reviews.text: My dog’s groomer recommended this product when I asked her if she knew why the dog was constantly chomping on her feet. She said it was an allergic reaction to her food. I switched to this brand. Problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Topaz Fire

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food!
customer_reviews.text: Every flavor of this brand of dog food has been great for my min pin mix's tummy. She's sensitive and this seems to help her digestion. She definitely likes the flavors too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent food - good value
customer_reviews.text: However i might have to move my dog to an even lower carb. he is old and having skin issues. Had i gotten him on this food early on in years - he might not of gotten any skin issues in later years.
customer_reviews.author: dianne

customer_reviews.title: My puppy adores these
customer_reviews.text: My vet said I should get a grain in puppy food. My scottie loves this. He also get wet food from science diet, and home made dinner. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Gilly

customer_reviews.title: Bag had holes, filled with ants
customer_reviews.text: We've ordered this product a few times, but this time we noted that the box it was delivered in and bag were covered in ants. The reason: the bag had two small holes at the base, just big enough for an entire colony to finds its way inside.
customer_reviews.author: Boogscott

customer_reviews.title: Dogs choice
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food. I have tried others but this is his favorite. Less stools, always firm and well developed. He is a senior but he doesn’t like the senior feed. He deserves to have what he likes since he does so well on it. Never puts on weight.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Great Food. Small Bites.
customer_reviews.text: Great product & ingredients. Exactly what I was looking for in a food with grains ... Unfortunately, just found out my dog is allergic to chicken. Otherwise I’d stick with this food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Merrick #1
customer_reviews.text: Great dog food, small bites for smaller breeds, can switch flavors without fearing upset tummies. Great product from great folks in Texas.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Puppy approved!
customer_reviews.text: My little puppy loves it! We buy all Merrick food for him and the dry food pieces are pretty small but I feel like it was still a tad too big for him. This is just the right size for him and not too "crunchy" that feel like his teeth are going to break haha
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My fussy eater
customer_reviews.text: My chorkie is a fussy eater. She likes nothing. So I ordered this food I have tried 10 different kinds at this point. But she loved the Merrick. I couldn't believe it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: good for the price, kibble might be too hard/tiny for super seniors/puppies
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a quality kibble. My dog is picky with taste though so I had to mix this with Merrick wet food and some warm water. Kibble is very tiny (smaller than your pinky nail) and possibly might be too tough for senior/puppies. But good if your dog chews well.
customer_reviews.author: Ma R.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My dog really did like this dry food; however, she put on too much weight when she was on this food. I had to change her diet to a dry food with less calories.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Made in America!
customer_reviews.text: I really always try to get the best for my dog and I found it here with this dog food. My dog has stopped itching since starting this food. I will only buy this brand for all my pets :)
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: My Shitzu loved it!
customer_reviews.text: My Shitzu stopped eating Royal Canin... wouldn’t touch it, so ordered this based on reviews. One meal down and she loved it. Fingers crossed that she continues to like it
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Excellent dog food
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves this dog food! We love the fact that it's made in the USA and feel confident that the ingredients are good quality ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My picky Pekingese dogs love this!
customer_reviews.text: This food is also great for treats for my miniature and full size Pekingese. It’s the only dry dog food they will eat but i still supplement with wet canned dog food as well. I love the really small kibble size.
customer_reviews.author: TAMMY A

customer_reviews.title: Dogs like us can get bored with the same food all ...
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loves this feed and when mixed with the same company's puppy feed will separate the puppy feed and set it aside even though it ate the puppy feed for 4 months. Dogs like us can get bored with the same food all the time
customer_reviews.author: David L. Poll

customer_reviews.title: We Love Merrick!  But the bag came with holes.
customer_reviews.text: We love Merrick!! However, I was very disappointed when the bag arrived today with holes in the bottom. I wanted to leave packaging feedback but I did not see the option.
customer_reviews.author: C Wagenknecht

customer_reviews.title: Love the company
customer_reviews.text: Love the company, its the only place I get my cat food from so I figured I would try it for my dog as well. Food seems to be good quality but didn't agree with my pups sensitive stomach .
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor, great value!
customer_reviews.text: Merlin loves his Merrick dry dog food. Any flavor. And his humans like the value of the food for the money. Win win!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the Same
customer_reviews.text: My dog and my mother’s dog have been on this food for years however the past 2 bags have plagued both with stomach issues. Something has changed in the formula or these bags are not being sourced or stored correctly by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Bluedog

customer_reviews.title: Great Dogfood but Bag Was Torn
customer_reviews.text: Received Merrick dog food early which was great however bag was ripped giving a little concern in these times My dogs love this dry food
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Premium Food that Dogs Love
customer_reviews.text: My 5 dogs love this food. They look forward to mealtime every day. Premium ingredients. The result is a solid stool, shiny coat and plenty of energy.
customer_reviews.author: Dadhertz

customer_reviews.title: Merrick
customer_reviews.text: My 11-year Shih Tzu loves it. They are soft and easy for him to eat. Merrick has a great reputation and I love their ingredients, so does my doggy.
customer_reviews.author: WArnold

customer_reviews.title: "THE BEST DOG FOOD EVER!"
customer_reviews.text: Sassy is my little picky Chihuahua and she loves this food!! So happy since I have tried over 20 other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Spears

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it and I trust Merrick
customer_reviews.text: Great product, dogs love it. I recently signed up for the auto ship. Love that I can get it on the "auto-ship" so I never run out.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Girl

customer_reviews.title: Love this food!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs do really well on this food. I have tried others over the years. Any from science diet to holistic foods. But I have found myself coming back to Merrick because my dogs stink less, there stools smell less, they get filled up quicker which means less stools, and they seem healthier and happier on it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves it and she appears to be very healthy, and i don't think in the 8 yrs we have used merrick, they have ever had a food recall!!
customer_reviews.author: flames9

customer_reviews.title: Best dogfood
customer_reviews.text: Great dog food, American made, with needed supplements added. The only dog food we’ve purchaseD for years!
customer_reviews.author: Bev  R.

customer_reviews.title: My dog finally has a food he loves!
customer_reviews.text: My dog was born with congenital heart valve disease. It has been a huge challenge to find a food suited for dogs with cardiomyopathy. The formulation is perfect for his heart health and nutrition. And he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Watters

product_meta.title: Merrick Classic Healthy Grains Dry Dog Food Puppy Recipe
product_meta.description: Style:With Healthy Grains| Flavor Name:Beef + Brown Rice| Size:25 LBBest-in-class nutrition and big-time taste? Merrick Classic Healthy Grains dry dog food treats your dog to both and more, in easily digestible recipes that balance protein, fruits, vegetables and a healthy blend of whole grains—including ancient grains to support optimal digestion—and supply high levels of fiber, Omega-3 and 6 fatty acids, glucosamine and chondroitin. Merrick Classic Healthy Grains is best for puppies and adult dogs. our Classic Healthy Grains dry dog food recipes are supplemented with Taurine and DL-methionine to ensure a balanced diet. Calorie Content: 3,648 kcal/kg or 386 kcal/cup ME (metabolizable energy) on an as-fed basis (calculated).
feature_bullets: One (1) 25.0 lb Bag - Merrick Classic Healthy Grains Dry Dog Food Real Beef + Brown Rice Recipe with Ancient Grains
Real deboned beef is always the first ingredient
Natural dog food with grain, including quinoa, supports healthy digestion
Leading levels of glucosamine and chondroitin for dogs to support healthy hips and joints
Omega-6 and omega-3 fatty acids in whole grain dog food support healthy skin and coat
